items.title: Release breathe compatible with Sphinx>=3.2
items.body: Breathe was made compatible with Sphinx >3.2 with commit: https://github.com/michaeljones/breathe/commit/8d07f406105c8196ac01519c770dd87c09d54465. This still requires publishing a new version of Breathe; there were so far two Sphinx releases on the 3.2 lineage.

items.title: Performance issues in C domain after scoped rendering changes
items.body:
While working on upgrading Sphinx/breathe versions for building Zephyr's docs (https://docs.zephyrproject.org/latest/) I found out some real slow-downs when running builds on C domain with newer versions. Those docs are currently built with `Sphinx==2.4.4` and `breathe==4.14.2`, and I am trying to switch to `Sphinx==3.0.4` (or newer) and `breathe==4.19.2`.

Currently there is no `breathe_domain_by_extension`, which means it uses the CPP domain. Here are the numbers:

1) `sphinx==2.4.4` / `breathe==4.14.2`
make html  753.11s user 10.48s system 99% cpu 12:47.00 total

2) `sphinx==3.0.4` / `breathe==4.19.2`
make html  809.96s user 10.10s system 99% cpu 13:45.28 total

Which is not too bad, but if I add a `breathe_domain_by_extension = {"h": "c", "c": "c"}` config I now get this numbers:

1) `sphinx==2.4.4` / `breathe==4.14.2`
make html  682.54s user 11.16s system 99% cpu 11:39.24 total

2) `sphinx==3.0.4` / `breathe==4.19.2`
make html  1389.20s user 7.88s system 99% cpu 23:20.49 total

Going from 682s to 1389s seems a bit excessive. Running with cProfile I see the slowdowns result from calls to `CObject._add_enumerator_to_parent()` -> `ASTBaseBase.clone()` -> `deepcopy()`. Not sure this is helpful or correct, and I wonder why `deepcopy()` calls would slow everything down. The specific commit where the issue starts to happen is this one: https://github.com/michaeljones/breathe/pull/512/commits/a2a1085e24022aececd2b93b46ade684f59d6ec0

items.title: Doxygen inner groups are not supported
Enum rendering broken after update
items.body:
Hi, thanks for this great project! I'm using it to create API reference and am happy with it.

Sorry if it's a duplicate, but I didn't find similar issue.

Recently my system upgraded to breathe 4.14.1 and sphinx 2.4.4, and enum values are now rendered with their numerical values instead of names.

Before:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8436629/86906653-8900d680-c11c-11ea-8ec3-105e4a0b046a.png)

After:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8436629/86906747-aa61c280-c11c-11ea-8f37-130ae55abcde.png)

(And also "enum" word disappeared, which is not cool too.)

The source code and sphinx code didn't change:

```
/** Forward Error Correction code. */
typedef enum roc_fec_code {
    /** No FEC code.
     * Compatible with \ref ROC_PROTO_RTP protocol.
     */
    ROC_FEC_DISABLE = -1,

    /** Default FEC code.
     * Current default is \ref ROC_FEC_RS8M.
     */
    ROC_FEC_DEFAULT = 0,

    /** Reed-Solomon FEC code (RFC 6865) with m=8.
     * Good for small block sizes (below 256 packets).
     * Compatible with \ref ROC_PROTO_RTP_RS8M_SOURCE and \ref ROC_PROTO_RS8M_REPAIR
     * protocols for source and repair endpoints.
     */
    ROC_FEC_RS8M = 1,

    /** LDPC-Staircase FEC code (RFC 6816).
     * Good for large block sizes (above 1024 packets).
     * Compatible with \ref ROC_PROTO_RTP_LDPC_SOURCE and \ref ROC_PROTO_LDPC_REPAIR
     * protocols for source and repair endpoints.
     */
    ROC_FEC_LDPC_STAIRCASE = 2
} roc_fec_code;
```

```
.. doxygentypedef:: roc_fec_code
   :outline:

.. doxygenenum:: roc_fec_code
```

The typedef stuff doesn't matter. If I remove typedef from source and sphinx, nothing changes.

Links:

* https://github.com/roc-streaming/roc-toolkit/blob/86c78426818cc9275a1c030314f833ea964f2651/src/library/include/roc/config.h#L176-L201
* https://raw.githubusercontent.com/roc-streaming/roc-toolkit/develop/docs/sphinx/api/reference.rst

This problem affects all enums. All of them are now rendered without names.

Let me know if I can provide more information or make some tests.

items.title: import breathe in setup.py
items.body:
In the `setup.py` file breathe is imported purely to get the version string. However, this causes for everything to be imported before it has actually been installed and before pip has installed the dependencies. 

https://github.com/michaeljones/breathe/blob/e3fcc6c38a8ace2fe51e6d08f7d6a4bb2c68d0a4/setup.py#L11
https://github.com/michaeljones/breathe/blob/e3fcc6c38a8ace2fe51e6d08f7d6a4bb2c68d0a4/setup.py#L27

Notably, if the dependencies are not yet satisfied you get an error. For example, if sphinx is not already installed I get an error that it can't import sphinx. This happens when installing via a pip `requirements.txt` file.

I've resolved it like this: https://github.com/rogerbarton/breathe/commit/8d92b3299193837dfebbd290d6777c4a0276287f However this means the version is duplicated.

This also caused my readthedocs.org builds to fail when installing the requirements.

items.title: :no-link: doesn't seem to work in my project
items.body:
I haven't been able to reproduce this in a small project, so please bear with me and let me know of any tests I can run to help you diagnose this problem.

I'm developing a pretty large document set (documenting an SDK), consisting of 221 rst files.  Breathe is processing Doxygen output generated from 104 header files.

Each header file's Doxygen generates a page of the API reference using a per-header rst file of the form:

    header_name.h
    =============

    High-level description of the header

    Usage
    =====

    .. code-block:: c

       #include <header_name.h>

    Contents
    --------

    .. doxygenfile:: header_name.h
       :project: PROJECTNAME

In various other (non-reference-manual) pages, I include links to the Doxygen-generated symbols using standard Sphinx markup of the form:

    :c:func:`funcname`

These seem to work OK.  But if I decide to include a copy of the function in one of those pages, using Breathe directives of the form:

    .. doxygenfunction:: funcname
       :project: PROJECTNAME
       :outline:
       :no-link:

Then links to the function end up pointing to the page where the "doxygenfunction" directive was used, even though I'm using the no-link option.  There is no anchor on the page for the link, but the generated links end up pointing there anyway.  And the anchor on the reference manual page goes away for the function.

I'm attaching a text file showing the diffs in the generated output with and without the "doxygenfunction" directive.  The files in the "working_output" directory don't use it and generate links as they should, while the files in the "broken_output" directory do use it and generate incorrect links.

The diffs for books/guide/concepts/event.html is a non-reference-manual page where I'm including (broken_output) or not including (working_output) a doxygenfunction directive for the function "jsom_event_queue_create".

The diffs for books/guide/event.html is another non-reference manual page that simply links to the function.

The diffs for reference/misc/jsom_event.html is the reference-manual page generated from a single header's Doxygen output.

[diff.txt](https://github.com/michaeljones/breathe/files/4838917/diff.txt)

As I wrote at the top of this message, I tried to reproduce this problem with a small example (one C header with two structs and two functions) but I could not reproduce the problem with it.  All the links worked as expected in that example.

I understand that the diffs I present may not be enough to diagnose the problem.  Feel free to suggest tests for me to run, or contact me off-line if you like.  I won't be able to send you my project source files, but maybe we can figure out enough so I can produce a test case that I can send you.

items.title: requirements prevent use of Sphinx 3.1.0
items.body:
- Sphinx 3.1.0 has been released today (https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/blob/3.x/CHANGES)
 - currently breathe requirements are forced to be` Sphinx>=3.0,<3.1` (related to recent change through #498)
 - suggest to bump up the Sphinx version requirements

items.title: nested namespaces wrongly ordered
items.body:
It seems to me that nested namespaces have the wrong order. E.g:

```cpp
namespace a { namespace b { namespace c {
void foo(int arg);
}}}
```

Rendering with this in the `.rst`:
```
.. doxygenfunction:: a::b::c::foo
```

Gives this HTML output:

```
void c::b::a::foo(int arg)
```

items.title: Renderer crash when visiting typedef

labels.name: regression
labels.description: Something broke that worked in the past

items.body:
Breathe 4.18.1 (Sphinx 3.0.3), was previously using Breathe 4.14.1 (Sphinx 2.4.3) which does not have this issue.

This header crashes the renderer:

    /**
     * My integer type.
     *
     * @typedef my_uint_t
     */
    
    /**
     * Maximum value of a my_uint_t variable.
     *
     * @def MY_UINT_MAX
     */
    
    #if defined SOME_MACRO
        typedef uint32_t my_uint_t;
        #define MY_UINT_MAX UINT32_MAX
    #else
        typedef uint64_t my_uint_t;
        #define MY_UINT_MAX UINT64_MAX
    #endif

The exception thrown is:

    Exception occurred:
    File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/breathe/renderer/sphinxrenderer.py", line 1476, in visit_typedef
    return self.handle_declaration(node, declaration)
    UnboundLocalError: local variable 'declaration' referenced before assignment

Having a look at the code, `declaration` is probably uninitialized because Breathe fails to retrieve the definition for the typedef, which is nested in the #ifdef, so none of the two conditions are met:

    if node.definition.startswith('typedef '):
        declaration = ' '.join([type_, name, node.get_argsstring()])
    elif node.definition.startswith('using '):
        # TODO: looks like Doxygen does not generate the proper XML
        #       for the template paramter list
        declaration = self.create_template_prefix(node)


Of course I can get it to work pretty easily by changing the condition to:

    if node.definition.startswith('using '):
        # TODO: looks like Doxygen does not generate the proper XML
        #       for the template paramter list
        declaration = self.create_template_prefix(node)
        declaration += ' ' + name + " = " + type_
    else:
        declaration = ' '.join([type_, name, node.get_argsstring()])

Though I'm not sure if that's the right course of action in all cases, so I don't know if this would be fine as a PR. Thoughts?

Thanks!

items.title: friend struct not handled since 4.17

labels.name: regression
labels.description: Something broke that worked in the past

items.body: We have code which uses `friend struct x;` (note: not `friend class`). Breathe does not like this since 4.17.0 because of https://github.com/michaeljones/breathe/commit/fa6df5ae8d83eb6fed51f1456ca94919eb3fa7b2, with the assertion here failing: https://github.com/michaeljones/breathe/blob/fa6df5ae8d83eb6fed51f1456ca94919eb3fa7b2/breathe/renderer/sphinxrenderer.py#L1519. I tried both 4.16.0 which still works, and 4.18.0 by changing `friend struct` to `friend class` which also works.

items.title: Breathe support for VHDL Doxygen output
items.body:
Hi all,

Set up:
 - Doxygen: 1.8.19
 - Breathe: 4.16.0
 - Sphinx: 3.0.3

I have a VHDL project documented with Doxygen and was hoping to port the XML output to readthedocs with Breathe. While I am sort of able to get the XML content to appear, it is not laid out very well, and I receive a lot of "Invalid C++ declaration" warnings when running 'make html'.

I suspect the Breathe was made purely for C++, but the Breathe documentation website does not state that explicitly and so I thought to check.

Please assist.
Thanks so much.
Talon.

items.title: Section titles in comments
items.body:
I get the following error message when trying to embed section titles into comments:
```
<breathe>:1: WARNING: Unexpected section title.

Mono Time
---------
<breathe>:1: WARNING: Unexpected section title.

Wall Time
---------
```

The generated doc does not show the section title.

Source:
```c++
/**
 * \file time.h
 * \verbatim embed:rst:leading-asterisk
 *
 * Mono Time
 * ---------
 *  | Mono time is a number of nanoseconds from some unknown start time.
 *  | This time cannot decrease and duration between ticks is constant.
 *  | This time is not related to wall clock time.
 *  | This time is most suitable for measuring durations.
 *  |
 *  | As a string, it is represented as a 20 char number:
 *  | **18446744072709551615**
 *
 * Wall Time
 * ---------
 *  | Wall time is an time object representing human-readable wall clock time.
 *  | This time can decrease and duration between ticks is not constant.
 *  | This time is most related to wall clock time.
 *  | This time is not suitable for measuring durations.
 *  |
 *  | As a string, it is represented as a 36 char RFC 3999 Nano / ISO 8601:
 *  | **2006-01-02T15:04:05.999999999-07:00**
 *
 * \endverbatim
 */
```

items.title: Link from function to enum is missing when the enum is inside a group
Latex Math results in empty formulas

labels.name: regression
labels.description: Something broke that worked in the past

items.body:
I tried to test the example from the documentation https://github.com/michaeljones/breathe/blob/master/documentation/source/latexmath.rst. In the current version with Sphinx 3.0.1 both formulas are empty: ```html

A class.

A inline formula: \(\)

A display style formula:

\[\]

``` With Sphinx 2.4.4 and breathe 14.4.2 the inline formula is working but the other formula is still missing: ```html

A class.

A inline formula: \( f(x) = a + b \)

A display style formula:

\[\]

``` The generated xml by doxygen looks fine: ```xml A class. A inline formula: $ f(x) = a + b $ A display style formula: \[ \int_a^b f(x) dx = F(b) - F(a) \] ``` A minimal example is as follows: `cat Source/mathhelper.h`: ```cpp /** * @brief A class * * A inline formula: \f$ f(x) = a + b \f$ * * A display style formula: * @f[ * \int_a^b f(x) dx = F(b) - F(a) * @f] */ class MathHelper { public: MathHelper() {} ~MathHelper() {} } ``` `cat Doxyfile`: ``` PROJECT_NAME = "latexmath" GENERATE_HTML = NO GENERATE_LATEX = NO GENERATE_XML = YES INPUT = "Source" OUTPUT_DIRECTORY = "doxygen" ``` `cat conf.py`: ```python project = 'Test Latex Math' extensions = ['breathe', 'sphinx.ext.mathjax'] breathe_projects = { "latexmath": "doxygen/xml/" } ``` `cat index.rst`: ```rst .. cpp:namespace:: @ex_latexmath .. doxygenclass:: MathHelper :project: latexmath :members: :undoc-members: ``` Run it with: ```bash doxygen Doxyfile sphinx-build -b html . sphinx_html ```

items.title: Error in declarator or parameters
items.body:
Now that https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/7423 is merged and Sphinx `3.0.1` is released, we can say that breathe `4.15.0` has a regression problem with some function definitions which worked well before.

Repro can be taken from my comment in Sphinx repo: https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/7423#issuecomment-610668512.

The problem is in the following functions.

```
LIGHTGBM_C_EXPORT int LGBM_BoosterFree(int handle);
```

```
Warning, treated as error:
/home/travis/build/microsoft/LightGBM/docs/C-API.rst:4:Error in declarator or parameters
Invalid C declaration: Expected identifier in nested name, got keyword: int [error at 21]
  LIGHTGBM_C_EXPORT int LGBM_BoosterAddValidData(BoosterHandle handle, const  DatasetHandle valid_data)
  ---------------------^
Makefile:20: recipe for target 'html' failed
```

Or is it a bug at Sphinx side?

items.title: Workaround for lack of @file filter
items.body:
Hey folks,

I'd like to structure a page somewhat like
```rst
Packets
=====================================

.. doxygenfile:: packet.h
   :file-only:

C API
-------------------------------------

.. doxygenstruct:: a0_packet_header_t
   :members:

.. doxygenstruct:: a0_packet_payload_t
   :members:

C++ API
-------------------------------------

.. doxygenclass:: a0::PacketHeader
   :members:

.. doxygenclass:: a0::PacketPayload
   :members:
```

Since `file-only` doesn't exist, I tried to be clever:
```rst
Packets
=====================================

.. doxygenfile:: packet.h

C++ API
-------------------------------------

.. doxygenclass:: a0::PacketHeader
   :members:

.. doxygenclass:: a0::PacketPayload
   :members:
```

Adding 
```cc
/**
 * /rst
 * C Api
 * -------------------------------------
 * /endrst
 */
```
to `packet.h`

Note: The documentation lives with the C API. There is another file that provides a minimal C++ wrapper.

This, of course, failed with:
```
<breathe>:1: WARNING: Unexpected section title.

C Api
-------------------------------------
```

For code readability reasons, I'd like to keep the overall description with the C API and would prefer not to duplicate it.

I haven't found any way to name & reference a standalone comment block...

Is there another approach, or is this not supported?

items.title: C "#define" does not expend the macros
items.body:
Hi all,

if i have macro in c header file,
`#define MIN(a, b)   ((a)>(b)? (b):(a))`

it seems that breathe won't expend it for me, it generate the following:
```
Define
        MIN(a, b)
```
However, i would like to show the expansion, just like the doxygen's output:
```
Define
        MIN(a, b) ((a)>(b)? (b):(a))
```
Is that possible or can you add this feature to breathe?

Thank you.

items.title: C domain generation doesn't work with Breathe v4.12+

labels.name: regression
labels.description: Something broke that worked in the past

items.body:
Hi,

When using the `breathe_domain_by_extension` variable in conf.py to set the domain of some files to be C, the documentation generated for enums is invalid. This is only true for Breathe versions v4.12 and up, v4.11 works OK.

The gist of it is that the enum definition below generates the output from the image copied below, where the enumerand names are missing.

``` c
/// A dummy enum
enum color {
    red   = 0xFF0000,
    green = 0x00FF00,
    blue  = 0x0000FF,
};
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3432890/76247679-500c3000-6216-11ea-8c51-75ee648bfeb4.png)

Here is a link to a minimal example that reproduces this issue: https://github.com/rdeterre/breatherepro

My setup for testing was the following:

- Windows machine
- Python 3.8.1
- Sphinx 2.4.1

I tried all releases of Breathe since v4.11.

items.title: Word wrapping for enum values
items.body:
Hello! 

  `.. doxygenenum:: TangleCheckResult` will result in:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/76137/75272790-97a2bd00-580f-11ea-8877-3003e65b45b8.png)

  that is, the value of `TCR_INDEPENDENT_IMAGES` is partly hidden when this enum is used:

```
typedef enum {
  TCR_FORWARD_PASS_POSSIBLE  = 0x01,
  TCR_BACKWARD_PASS_POSSIBLE = 0x02,
  TCR_INDEPENDENT_LINES      = 0x04,
  TCR_INDEPENDENT_IMAGES     = TCR_FORWARD_PASS_POSSIBLE |
                               TCR_BACKWARD_PASS_POSSIBLE |
                               TCR_INDEPENDENT_LINES,
  ///< Images do not intersect in memory.
} TangleCheckResult;
```

items.title: Port testsuite to pytest, using sphinx's testing module
items.body:
Current unit tests are rather hacky, Sphinx and Breathe keep diverging due to fundamental differences in used frameworks. Over time, more small issues are likely to show up that need even more hacks to keep things working.

Porting the testsuite to pytest and using sphinx's testing module will simplify Breathe's testing itself and make it possible to use Sphinx's own testing fixtures, among other things. This will reduce the complexity of our own tests as we let Sphinx handle more and more things for us.

See #472 for further details, Sphinx doc is at https://www.sphinx-doc.org/en/master/devguide.html#unit-testing.

items.title: How to reference to generated docs
items.body:
It seems I do not understand or it is not possible, how to do it.

I have a .rst with directive `.. doxygengroup:: MYGROUP` and it nicely generates all the functions, typededs, etc in this file => very nice.

Now I have second .rst file and I would like to reference from there to description of my function in first .rst file.

`api.rst`: Doxygen generated description
```
.. doxygengroup:: MYGROUP

# part of MYGROUP is function "input" and its description is well generated
```

`how-to.rst`: Here I want to reference to function `input`
```
..
Please check function :ref:`input` for more information.
..
```

How do I properly reference function `input` in *how-to.rst* file to generate a link to its description in *api.rst* file?

items.title: Cross-referencing macros
items.body:
Breathe allows documenting C-like macros, e.g.:
```rest
.. doxygendefine:: ARROW_RETURN_NOT_OK

.. doxygendefine:: ARROW_ASSIGN_OR_RAISE
```

But I haven't found any way to cross-reference them. i've tried `:c:macro:`, `:c:func:`, `:cpp:func:` and even `:cpp:any:`.

items.title: Bit field broken in pybind11 docs
items.body:
I'm not entirely sure how or why, but it seems that the latest release of `breathe` broke the documentation builds of the pybind11 project. The build now fails with the following error:
```
/home/travis/build/pybind/pybind11/docs/reference.rst:60:Invalid definition: Expected end of definition. [error at 25]

  bool arg::flag_noconvert :  1
```

See https://travis-ci.org/pybind/pybind11/jobs/623594114#L354 (and https://travis-ci.org/pybind/pybind11/jobs/616701615 for the last working build).

Relevant line in pybind11:
https://github.com/pybind/pybind11/blob/37352491225358b97ce302273bf2d887a477efb0/include/pybind11/cast.h#L1822

Given that the differences between 4.13.1 and 4.14 are limited, https://github.com/michaeljones/breathe/commit/c2ff07c03b018ebb7888f6ff553c77481fe27116 seems to be a good candidate for the breaking changes. Is pybind11 now using breathe in a wrong way, or is this a corner case that isn't handled correctly by breathe?

(pinging @bstaletic)

items.title: Bug with trailing return types for c++ source code
items.body:
It seems like trailing return types in c++ cannot get parsed correctly by breathe. Here is an example:

Original source code including a trailing return type:

```
class Thingy;

//! \brief Function that creates a thingy.
auto MakeThingy() -> Thingy*;
```

The generated xml output of doxygen:
```
      <sectiondef kind="func">
      <memberdef kind="function" id="id" prot="public" static="no" const="no" explicit="no" inline="no" virt="non-virtual">
        <type>auto</type>
        <definition>auto MakeThingy</definition>
        <argsstring>() -> Thingy *</argsstring>
        <name>MakeThingy</name>
        <briefdescription>
<para>Function that creates a thingy. </para>
        </briefdescription>
        <detaileddescription>
        </detaileddescription>
        <inbodydescription>
        </inbodydescription>
        <location file=..." line="17" column="1"/>
      </memberdef>
      </sectiondef>
```
The index.rst for sphinx:

```
	.. doxygenfunction:: MakeThingy
```

And the final index.html generated with sphinx and breathe:

![makethingy](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/27962036/59491610-6489ea80-8e87-11e9-8ba4-51c037db7986.PNG)


Unfortunately, the final index.html is missing the trailing return type which is essential for understanding the function's signature. Doxygen itself seems to be able to handle the trailing return types somehow.

Is there a possibility for you to fix this issue?

items.title: breathe-Derivatives not working for global members.
support for `internal` modifier in c#
items.body:
First, thanks for this great project.

I am aware that breathe (and sphinx) does not support c#, but apart from some quirks with properties (as in #249 ) i have been using it with good results for public members so far.

I am now trying to build internal documentation for my project which would require generating documentation for `internal` members.

I know this is language specific, but would it be possible, by any chance, to have something similar to `:protected-members:` directive, i.e. `:internal-members:` or `:package:members:`, that would enable to show these correctly?

slightly eddited sample xml:

```xml
<codeline lineno="123">
    <highlight class="normal"><sp/><sp/><sp/><sp/></highlight>
    <highlight class="keyword">internal</highlight>
    <highlight class="normal"><sp/></highlight>
    <highlight class="keywordtype">void</highlight>
    <highlight class="normal"><sp/><ref refid="class_foo_bar" kindref="member">Boo</ref>()</highlight>
</codeline>

<sectiondef kind="package-func">
    <memberdef kind="function" id="class_foo_bar" prot="package" static="no" const="no" explicit="no" inline="yes" virt="non-virtual">
    </memberdef>
</sectiondef>

<listofallmembers>
    <member refid="class_foo_bar" prot="package" virt="non-virtual">
        <scope>Foo::Bar</scope>
        <name>Boo</name>
    </member>
</listofallmembers>
```

For now i am replacing:
  - `internal` keyword with `protected`,
  - `kind="package-func"` with `kind="protected-func"` and
  - `prot="package"` with `prot="protected"`

after the xml is generated and using `:protected-members:`, which apart from misleading header `Protected Functions` works fine. 

Could you maybe suggest something better?

python from my conf.py for reference:

```python
read_the_docs_build = os.environ.get('READTHEDOCS', None) == 'True'

if not read_the_docs_build:
    subprocess.call('pwd; cd ./doxygen; doxygen', shell=True)

    # change internal members into protected members
    directory = './doxygen/doxyxml'
    for file in os.listdir(directory):
        with open("{}/{}".format(directory,file)) as f:
            newText=f.read() \
                     .replace('>internal<', '>protected<') \
                     .replace('kind="package-func"', 'kind="protected-func"') \
                     .replace('prot="package"', 'prot="protected"')

        with open("{}/{}".format(directory,file), "w") as f:
            f.write(newText)
```

Best,
nnm

items.title: require a newer version of Sphinx
items.body:
The requirement for Sphinx is set to:

    Sphinx>=1.4

But since this commit: https://github.com/michaeljones/breathe/commit/1799bb9d it is no longer possible to use Sphinx that is 1.8.4 or older (see https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/commit/6d52b63eee) 

If an environment with anything 1.8.4 or older will break with:

    AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'CPPUnionObject'

#ifndef FOO_H_
#define FOO_H_

void foo();

#endif 
```

```
/**
 * \file
 *
 * \brief foo source code
 */

#include "foo.h"
/**
 * foo func implementation
 */
void foo()
{
    ;  
}
```

I believe it's a very common way of arranging C code, but when I do this with doxygen+breathe, I got warning `WARNING: Duplicate declaration`, and also at first error but fixed I believe #394 with git version of sphinx. I also saw https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/4820 but it looks like a different case. 

I think it's that doxygen creates symbol for the `foo` in both header file and .c file. So what should be the practice for such use case? 

Thank you!

items.title: AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'content_'
items.body:
### Problem
I get the error `AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'content_'` when I try to build documentation using Sphinx + Breathe + Doxygen. Breathe 4.11 already implements the code suggested by @tk0miya (https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/3709#issuecomment-299645822), but the suggestion to fix does not work.

#### Procedure to reproduce the problem
Unfortunately I can not share the code of my project, but I was able to reproduce the error in [another project](https://github.com/QuantStack/xtensor) that also uses Sphinx + Breathe + Doxygen. 

1. Add a '_doxyfile.rst_' file in '_xtensor/docs/source/_' with the content:
```
Doxygen Files
=============
.. doxygenindex::
   :project: xtensor
```
2. Add '_doxyfile_' to the '_index.rst_' file. You may also need to add the `breathe_default_project = "xtensor"` line to the `conf.py` file.

3. Then you execute `make html` on '_xtensor/docs/_' and the error appears.

The error does not occur when I use `.. doxygenclass :: <Project class>`, only with `.. doxygenindex ::`. I understand it might be a Breathe bug, but I do not know.

items.title: Source Code in Sphinx?
items.body:
Hello,

Thanks for the wonderful package! Is it possible to automatically generate a Sphinx documentation page for C++ source files, such as [in Doxygen](http://libusb.sourceforge.net/api-1.0/libusb_8h_source.html)? I'm not sure I've seen anyone do this yet, but it would be very handy!

Thanks,
Oliver

items.title: verbatim should not be highlighted as code
items.body:
The following C declaration ```cpp /** * @verbatim return abcd @endverbatim * * @param[out] dest Destination pointer. * @param[in] src Source pointer * @param n number of bytes */ void *memcpy(void *dest, const void *src, size_t n); ``` outputs the following XML ```xml return abcd ``` and if I look into the HTML output I get ```html 
return abcd
``` The documentation of `verbatim` says in [1] > Starts a block of text that will be verbatim included in the documentation. The block should end with >a \endverbatim command. All commands are disabled in a verbatim block. so I don't expect syntax highlightning in a verbatim block. A test repo is at [2]. [1]: http://www.stack.nl/~dimitri/doxygen/manual/commands.html#cmdverbatim [2]: https://github.com/t-b/breathe-doxygen-filter-test

items.title: Major history rewrite
items.body:
Has there been a recent large-scale history rewrite on this project? Has anyone done a force push after a git filter-branch?

cppnetlib has this library as a submodule:
https://github.com/cpp-netlib/cpp-netlib/pull/582

If you try to clone cppnetlib and update submodules, it can't find a SHA that used to exist here (that is, "git submodule update" fails).

items.title: Strange spacing for class members
items.body:
I noticed a strange quirk with the rendering of the `doxygenclass` rule: The Top level class renders properly with the namespace and class-name separated by `::`s.

![breath-error_top-level](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14112725/38562591-f1d33f72-3ca8-11e8-9c80-45ee6a8b1760.png)

But there appears to be improper spacing for any of the members:

![breathe_error_typedef-spacing](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14112725/38562592-f1eba166-3ca8-11e8-938f-5689be0f2aa1.png)
![breathe_error_public_function](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14112725/38562593-f20166e0-3ca8-11e8-9d13-1b4be4025770.png)

As far as I can tell, in regular python projects these should be separated by a `.` character, and thus I feel like in breathe's generated documentation they should be separated by a `::`.  That is, we should have:

```cpp
typedef model::Model::State
```

```cpp
virtual void model::Model::init(const Model::State &state, const Model::Control &control) = 0
```

I looked through the functions that appear to render the signature but I can't quite make head or tails of it and understand where the different parts of the signature come from.

Thanks!

items.title: better info around breathe parser error in init.py
items.body:
This error has come back on two completely different Linux systems (OSes), and 
it comes back the same on both. I think that is that it is a problem in the 
parser itself, not the code. My guess is that it is either the parser or the 
way I've documented a cpp code block in `.rst`, but it is not clear which. 

If it is the latter (my mistake), this needs better error messages to the user 
since `breathe.parser.ParserError: unclosed token: line 152, column 129` on an
 `__init.py__` file is kind of hard to debug. 

Here's the env 

```
Loaded extensions:
#   breathe (4.7.3) from /home/username/.local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/breathe/__init__.py
#   sphinx.ext.ifconfig (1.6.5) from /home/username/.local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/sphinx/ext/ifconfig.py
#   sphinx.ext.viewcode (1.6.5) from /home/username/.local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/sphinx/ext/viewcode.py
#   sphinx.ext.mathjax (1.6.5) from /home/username/.local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/sphinx/ext/mathjax.py
#   alabaster (0.7.10) from /home/username/.local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/alabaster/__init__.py
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/username/.local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/breathe/parser/__init__.py", line 48, in parse
    return self.cache[filename]
KeyError: '/home/username/libraries/project-name/doc/sphinx/source/../../doxygen/xml/index.xml'
```

And here is the error: 

```
.local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/breathe/parser/__init__.py", line 57, in parse
    raise ParserError(e, filename)
breathe.parser.ParserError: unclosed token: line 152, column 129
```

If the error is in the code for which I am writing documentation, it should not
say that breathe is the problem; that is what is says, though.  

The `.rst` file that it is trying to parse when it throws this error is of this 
format:

```rst
.. filename.rst

########
FileName
########

.. code-block:: cpp
   LaLa  // one line of cpp code short description


Description
===========

Some interesting long-description descriptive info written in .rst. Maybe one
paragraph.

Maybe many paragraphs.

Inputs
------

+-----------------+-------------------------+--------------------------------+
| Name            | Element Type            | Col 3                          |
+=================+=========================+================================+
| ``arg``         | Any                     | Any                            |
+-----------------+-------------------------+--------------------------------+

Outputs
-------

+-----------------+-------------------------+--------------------------------+
| Name            | Element Type            | Col 3                          |
+=================+=========================+================================+
| ``arg``         | Any                     | Any                            |
+-----------------+-------------------------+--------------------------------+

C++ Interface
=============

.. doxygenclass::foo::bar::Something
   :project: projectname
   :members: 



```



The more informative debug info in sphinx-log

```
File "/home/username/.local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/breathe/finder/core.py", line 87, in create_finder
    root = self.parser.parse(project_info)
  File "/home/username/.local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/breathe/parser/__init__.py", line 57, in parse
    raise ParserError(e, filename)
breathe.parser.ParserError: unclosed token: line 152, column 129
```

Thanks!

items.title: help me fix the full template specializations?
items.body:
I'm working with the [specialization here](https://github.com/svenevs/exhale-companion/blob/master/include/arbitrary/DerivedClass.h#L39).  For reference

### unspecialized

```rst
.. doxygenclass:: arbitrary::DerivedClass
   :members:
   :protected-members:
   :undoc-members:
```

warnings:

```
WARNING: /Users/sven/Dropbox/fun/exhale-companion/docs/api/class_arbitrary__DerivedClass.rst:31: (WARNING/2) Too many template argument lists compared to parameter lists. Argument lists: 1, Parameter lists: 0, Extra empty parameters lists prepended: 1. Declaration:
	arbitrary::DerivedClass<T, N>::items
```

### partial specialization

```rst
.. doxygenclass:: DerivedClass<arbitrary::arbitrary_struct, N>
   :members:
   :protected-members:
   :undoc-members:
```

warnings

```
WARNING: /Users/sven/Dropbox/fun/exhale-companion/docs/api/class_arbitrary__DerivedClassLT__arbitrary__arbitrary_struct_COMMA_N__GT.rst:30: (WARNING/2) Too many template argument lists compared to parameter lists. Argument lists: 1, Parameter lists: 0, Extra empty parameters lists prepended: 1. Declaration:
	arbitrary::DerivedClass<arbitrary::arbitrary_struct, N>
```

### full specialization (?)

```rst
.. doxygenclass:: arbitrary::DerivedClass< bool, 2 >
   :members:
   :protected-members:
   :undoc-members:
```

warnings

```
WARNING: /Users/sven/Dropbox/fun/exhale-companion/docs/api/class_arbitrary__DerivedClassLT__bool_COMMA_2__GT.rst:22: (WARNING/2) Too many template argument lists compared to parameter lists. Argument lists: 1, Parameter lists: 0, Extra empty parameters lists prepended: 1. Declaration:
	arbitrary::DerivedClass<bool, 2>
```

### where do I start?

**Update** ok I did a lot of digging and I think I've figured out what the problem is here.  The `sphinxrenderer` is creating the right signatures, but this happens too late.

```py
# breathe/sphinxrenderer method
def create_template_node(self, decl):
    """Creates a node for the ``template <...>`` part of the declaration."""
    if not decl.templateparamlist:
        return None
    template = 'template '
    nodes = [self.node_factory.desc_annotation(template, template), self.node_factory.Text('<')]
    nodes.extend(self.render(decl.templateparamlist))
    nodes.append(self.node_factory.Text(">"))
    signode = self.node_factory.desc_signature()
    signode.extend(nodes)
    return signode
```

This works perfectly, but the issue is this information actually needs to be a part of the [`sphinx/domain/cpp.py:CPPObject`](https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/blob/00169a07e6290f7efce2c9ab0219ccfff6788cf8/sphinx/domains/cpp.py#L5066-L5068).

Presumably the same or similar logic can be used, but it has to happen much sooner.  I did "editable" installs of sphinx and breathe and the warnings are emitted before the render signature is created (which makes sense).

In the same file in `breathe/sphinxrenderer.py` the class `DomainDirectiveFactory` has

```py
@staticmethod
def create(domain, args):
    if domain == 'c':
        return c.CObject(*args)
    if domain == 'py':
        cls, name = DomainDirectiveFactory.python_classes.get(
            args[0], (python.PyClasslike, 'class'))
        args[1] = [DomainDirectiveFactory.fix_python_signature(n) for n in args[1]]
    else:
        cls, name = DomainDirectiveFactory.cpp_classes.get(
            args[0], (cpp.CPPMemberObject, 'member'))
    # Replace the directive name because domain directives don't know how to handle
    # Breathe's "doxygen" directives.
    args = [name] + args[1:]
    ### !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
    return cls(*args)
```

So is the right place to be doing this at `### !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!` or somewhere else entirely?  E.g.

```py
obj = cls(*args)
# do some magic to find template parameters and populate
return obj
```

items.title: Breathe on pypi corrupted?
items.body:
I updated my local install of breathe to 4.7.1 in order to get some various fixes.  However, the version on pypi appears to be having some issues - the breathe-apidoc command fails with a syntax error.

Best I can tell, the syntax error is occurring because the line `from __future__ import print_function` is missing from the top of breathe/apidoc.py.  I went back to version 4.6.0 and it's in there as well as existing in the master version, but for some reason 4.7.0 and 4.7.1 are missing that line.  Even after fixing that I get another exception when sphinx is running that does not occur when using a local copy of the GitHub repository where I checked out the specific tag.

Diffing the installed version against the tags from GitHub is showing differences as well, it appears that what was published to pypi wasn't a clean copy at the time, unless pypi has some automatic scripts that run when you publish to it?  It appears most of the differences are related to unicode and some extra casting and such.

items.title: Incorrect rendering of a struct with union - ‘Expected identifier in nested name’
items.body:
When a header file contains definition of a structure with union as follows:

```c
typedef struct {
    esp_a2d_mct_t type;                        /*!< A2DP media codec type */
#define ESP_A2D_CIE_LEN_SBC          (4)
#define ESP_A2D_CIE_LEN_M12          (4)
#define ESP_A2D_CIE_LEN_M24          (6)
#define ESP_A2D_CIE_LEN_ATRAC        (7)
    union {
        uint8_t sbc[ESP_A2D_CIE_LEN_SBC];
        uint8_t m12[ESP_A2D_CIE_LEN_M12];
        uint8_t m24[ESP_A2D_CIE_LEN_M24];
        uint8_t atrac[ESP_A2D_CIE_LEN_ATRAC];
    } cie;                                     /*!< A2DP codec information element */
} __attribute__((packed)) esp_a2d_mcc_t;
```

Then rendering of union member of this structure is faulty.

![screenshot from 2017-08-12 21-15-12](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12953787/29243609-6615dbf6-7fa3-11e7-9aad-fee4a9fd46c9.png)

The following warning is shown during documentation build::

```
(WARNING/2) Invalid definition: Expected identifier in nested name. [error at 21]
union esp_a2d_mcc_t::@0  esp_a2d_mcc_t::cie
---------------------^
```

Header file that contains code causing this issue https://github.com/krzychb/rtd-test-bed/blob/master/headers/esp_a2dp_api.h

Details of packages that cause this issue:
* Sphinx 1.6.3
* Breathe 4.7.0
Previous packages, e.g. Sphinx 1.5.6 and Breathe 4.6.0 have the same issue.

Example documentation - http://rtd-test-bed.readthedocs.io/en/latest/case-struct-union.html

* Have seen this issue before?
* Where to look for resolution?

Hi Breathe Users and Maintainers,

After upgrade from Breathe release 4.6.0 to 4.7.0 I am getting the following error during documentation build:

```
Exception occurred:
  File "C:/msys32/mingw32/lib/python2.7/site-packages/breathe/renderer/sphinxrenderer.py", line 206, in get_domain

items.title: Best way to make Sphinx latexpdf documentation include page breaks between function definitions
items.body:
Hi,

I'm wondering what would be the best way to make the Latex documentation generated using Sphinx and Breathe include page breaks between functions.

I've seen that rst2pdf has a `pdf_break_level` variable that can be used, but the [best solution](https://stackoverflow.com/a/26127641/1857952) with latexpdf seems to be to add raw latex directives in the source code.

Is there an alternative to this that would allow to get page breaks whenever the `.. doxygenfunction` directive is used?

Thanks

items.title: Project maintainence
items.body:
Hi everyone,

I think it has come time that I admit to myself that I will not be returning to a more active role in this project. I am very proud of the little community here, very grateful to those who have contributed and hugely happy to see people posting, helping each other and seeking to improve Breathe.

I apologise for my lack of activity. I have long felt that I can try to help out as much as I can but it is becoming harder and harder to step back in. 

It is great to see so many helping out. If there is anything I can do to help this project continue without my active involved please let me know in this thread.

Kind regards,
Michael

items.title: Issues with processing of C structures with  __attribute__
items.body:
I have identified two issues with documenting the following structure:

```c
/// UUID type
typedef struct {
#define ESP_UUID_LEN_16     2
#define ESP_UUID_LEN_32     4
#define ESP_UUID_LEN_128    16
    uint16_t len;							/*!< UUID length, 16bit, 32bit or 128bit */
    union {
        uint16_t    uuid16;
        uint32_t    uuid32;
        uint8_t     uuid128[ESP_UUID_LEN_128];
    } uuid;									/*!< UUID */
} __attribute__((packed)) esp_bt_uuid_t;;
```

(1) When attempting to use:

```
.. doxygenstruct::  esp_bt_uuid_t
```
I got error:

```
WARNING: doxygenstruct: Cannot find class "esp_bt_uuid_t" in doxygen xml output for project "esp32-idf" from directory: xml/
```

(2) When attempting to use `.. doxygenfile::` to render the whole header file that contains this structure: 

```
.. doxygenfile:: esp_bt_defs.h
```

I got the following output:

![screenshot from 2017-05-06 15-04-27](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12953787/25772551/5677013e-326e-11e7-9889-fc70f49e8692.png)

The second case of this issue is related to #287.

It looks like breathe is confused with `__attribute__`. 

Is there a way to resolve this issue?

items.title: Make crossref rendering consistent with sphinx?
items.body:
I noticed that in the HTML output of breathe, cross-references between classes, functions etc. appearing in the doxygen markup are rendered in a different way with respect to the cross-references generated by sphinx's C++ domain functionalities. I.e., the cross links coming out from doxygen are rendered with an underline and differently-coloured text, whereas pure sphinx crosslinks (e.g., using ``:cpp:class:`foo` ``) are rendered in bold text without underline.

It's just a minor cosmetic inconsistency, but would it be possible to modify breathe to render cross references in the same way as sphinx does?
